text:
Argonia is a city in Sumner County, Kansas, United States. In 2010, 501 people lived there.
History.
Argonia was created in 1881. It was named after the ship "Argo" in Greek mythology. In 1887, Susanna M. Salter became the first woman to win political office in United States history; she was elected Mayor of Argonia.
Geography.
Argonia is at (37.265299, -97.766123). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
2010 census.
The 2010 census says that there were 501 people, 216 households, and 135 families living in Argonia.
Education.
Argonia is part of the Argonia USD 359 school district.
